_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Support Activities for Water Transportation
Other Support Activities for Water Transportation

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC (Stolthaven) is a for-hire public bulk liquid storage and transfer facility. The facility is adjacent to the Mississippi River at Mile Point 80.   The facility receives, stores, and transfers a wide variety of bulk liquid materials including food grade oils, fuels, solvents, and industrial chemicals.  Bulk products are stored in aboveground storage tanks surrounded by secondary containment diked sized to contain a complete failure of the largest tank and rainfall associated with the 25 year, 24 hour storm event within the containment area.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies 

Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC is committed to operating in a safe and compliant manner. 
Employees involved in operating the acrylonitrile and cyclohexylamine handling facilities are trained to identify and understand the hazards posed during the storage and transfer process.  Training includes the review of information pertaining to the hazards of acrylonitrile and cyclohexylamine, process technology, process equipment, and emergency response procedures. The facility maintains written process safety information to enable employees involved in handling both acrylonitrile and cyclohexylamine to identify and understand the hazards posed by these processes.  Written training information includes the physical properties of acrylonitrile and cyclohexylamine, the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.  Process safety and emergency response materials are kept on site and periodically reviewed.

Regulated Substances Handled 

Stolthaven handles more than the threshold quantities of both acrylonitrile (20,000 pounds) and cyclohexylamine (15,000 pounds). Stolthaven is regulated under the Program 2 requirements of 68.10.

Accidental Release Prevention Program  

Stolthaven?s accidental release prevention program includes all the elements required under Par

t 68 Subpart C including, Safety Information 68.48; Hazard Review 68.50; Operating Procedures 68.52; Training 68.54; Maintenance 68.56; Compliance Audits 68.58; and Incident Investigation 68.60.  Employees are provided with written training information which includes the physical properties of acrylonitrile and cyclohexylamine, the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.
The facility management stresses the development and importance of the process safety information, a management of change procedure, pre-startup safety reviews, employee participation in safety reviews.

The five-year accident history 

The facility has never had an accident involving the covered chemicals that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.
The emergency response program 

Stolthaven has a Facility Response Plan and SPCC Plan which outlines the coordination with local agencies in the event of spill or release.  

Planned changes to improve safety 

Continuous Safety Training for employees.
